titleStmt.title: J. Sellers et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10838

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Govenor of Ky Your Petitioners who were on the Jury that sentanced Mariah Femcond to the penetientary for one year ask and humbly solicit your honor to Grant her a repreive ^pardon^ as we believe she committed the offence she was charged with without any intention to wrong any one as she was Excited by small as she confessed before us She is pregnant and her husband has left her and gone to the Army ,
In compliance your petitioners will Ever pray &c
Names of Petitioners Jurymen who tried the case

J. Sellers
W. A. Moxley
Hiram Bond
David Harris
F. Herrmann
F. Dresmann
N Mahan
Jos Hawlin
John A Darnell
Wm Long
Obed Meek
Lewis Collins
W. E. Arthur, Atty Com'th. The above are the names of the Jurors who tried the case.
I concur with the above statement
Will Govenor B Magoffin if he can concienciously please attend to the within forth with and oblige

Kenton Cir. Ct
Mariah Femcourt
Felony
1 yr. Penty
Pardon Issd
SepOcto 1. 1861
